newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: Strong results propel Captall to new high.
newsitem.headline: Strong results propel Captall to new high.

text.p: Shares in South African financials to mining group Capital Alliance Holdings Ltd (Captall) leapt to a new high at the start of trade on Friday, boosted by a jump in year earnings reported late on Thursday.
Captall rose 400 cents to a best level of 39 rand, making it the third best performer on the Johannesburg Stock Exchange.
By 0740 GMT it had slipped off its peak to 38 rand -- a gain of 300 cents.

Captall, which earlier this year was part of a consortium which secured control of South Africa' sixth biggest mining house JCI Ltd reported year earnings at 102.4 cents a share before exceptional items, almost doubling last year's 52.9 cents a year ago.
"The results were exceptional. With results like these its obvious the share price will go up," a dealer said.
Captall posted a dividend of 15.0 cents from 10.0 previously.
But dealers said profit-taking may emerge at the higher levels.
"It has run a lot today. At these (thin) volumes the rise may not be sustainable especially as it looks like jobbers are punting it now," another trader said.
Captall chairman Mzi Khumalo said that a substantial earnings rise could be expected "over time" and that the opportunities for organic growth and acquisitive expansion were available.
